doc:
Pablito Calvo https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pablito_Calvo 0 Pablito Calvo (real name Pablo Calvo Hidalgo) (16 March 1948 – 1 February 2000) was a Spanish child actor. After the international success of Marcelino, pan y vino, where he won a Cannes Film Festival award (1955), he became Spain's most famous child actor. He did five more films, even in Italy, with Totò. Retired from acting at the age of 16 to become an industrial engineer later, he worked in tourism and promoting buildings in Torrevieja. Calvo sang in a few films, but his singing voice was always dubbed on screen, in Spain by a woman, Matilde F. Vilariño. Pablito_Calvo ( real_name_Pablo_Calvo_Hidalgo ) ( 16_March_1948 – 1_February_2000 ) was a_Spanish_child_actor . After the_international_success of Marcelino , pan_y_vino , where he won a_Cannes_Film_Festival_award ( 1955_) , he became Spain 's most_famous child_actor . He did five_more_films , even in Italy , with Totò . Retired from acting at the_age of 16 to_become an_industrial_engineer later , he worked in tourism and promoting buildings in Torrevieja . Calvo sang in a_few_films , but his_singing_voice was_always_dubbed on screen , in Spain by a_woman , Matilde_F._Vilariño .
